name: Ext.chart.interactions.ItemEdit
doc:
The 'itemedit' interaction allows the user to edit store data by dragging series items in the chart.

The 'itemedit' interaction extends the 'itemhighlight' interaction, so it also acts like one. If you need both interactions in a single chart, 'itemedit' should be sufficient. Hovering/tapping will result in highlighting, and dragging will result in editing.

members.name: chart
members.doc: The chart that the interaction is bound.

members.name: gesture
members.doc: Maps gestures that should be used for starting/maintaining/ending the interaction to corresponding class methods.

members.name: multiTooltips
members.doc: Enable displaying multiple tooltips for overlapping or adjacent series items within Ext.chart.series.Line.selectionTolerance radius. Default is to display a tooltip only for the last series item rendered. When multiple tooltips are displayed, they may overlap partially or completely; it is up to the developer to ensure tooltip positioning is satisfactory.
members.short_doc:
Enable displaying multiple tooltips for overlapping or adjacent series items within
Ext.chart.series.Line.selectionTo...

members.name: renderer
members.doc: A function that returns style attributes for the item that's being dragged. This is useful if you want to give a visual feedback to the user when they dragged to a certain point.

properties.name: target
properties.doc: The object containing the xField/xValue or/and yField/yValue properties, where the xField/yField specify the store records being edited and the xValue/yValue the target values to be set when the interaction ends. The object also contains the 'index' of the record being edited.

properties.name: style
properties.doc: The style that is going to be used for the dragged item. The attributes returned by the renderer will be applied on top of this style.

properties.name: item
properties.doc: The series item being dragged. This is actually the Ext.chart.AbstractChart.highlightItem.

return.name: return
return.doc: The style attributes to be set on the dragged item.

members.short_doc: A function that returns style attributes for the item that's being dragged. ...

members.name: style
members.doc: The style that will be applied to the series item on dragging. By default, series item will have no fill, and will have a dashed stroke of the same color.
members.short_doc: The style that will be applied to the series item on dragging. ...

members.name: throttleGap
members.doc: Android device is emerging too many events so if we re-render every frame it will take forever to finish a frame. This throttle technique will limit the timespan between two frames.
members.short_doc:
Android device is emerging too many events so if we re-render every frame it will
take forever to finish a frame. ...

members.name: getItemForEvent
members.doc: Find and return a single series item corresponding to the given event, or null if no matching item is found.

return.name: return
return.doc: the item object or null if none found.

members.short_doc:
Find and return a single series item corresponding to the given event,
or null if no matching item is found. ...

members.name: getItemsForEvent
members.doc: Find and return all series items corresponding to the given event.
members.short_doc: Find and return all series items corresponding to the given event. ...

return.name: return
return.doc: The style attributes to be set on the dragged item.

members.name: beginitemedit

params.name: item
params.doc: The item that is about to be edited.

members.short_doc: Fires when item edit operation (dragging) begins. ...

members.name: enditemedit

params.name: target
params.doc: The object containing target values the were used.

members.short_doc: Fires when item edit operation (dragging) ends. ...

short_doc:
The 'itemedit' interaction allows the user to edit store data
by dragging series items in the chart. ...
